description:
Welcome to Maebashi City, Gunma Prefecture. For first-year high school student Yuina Akagi, her middling life takes a wild turn the moment a mysterious frog named Keroppe shows up and asks her, “Why don’t you become a witch?” Alongside Azu Niisato, Kyouka Kitahara, Choco Mitsumata, and Mai Kamiizumi, Yuina and her friends are excited to make people’s dreams come true as the Maebashi Witches.

(Source: Crunchyroll)
synonyms: มาเอบาชิวิชซ์

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Witch
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a witch.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Idol
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of an idol.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Dancing
tags.description: Centers around the art of dance.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Body Image
tags.description: Features themes of self-esteem concerning perceived defects or flaws in appearance, such as body weight or disfigurement, and may discuss topics such as eating disorders, fatphobia, and body dysmorphia.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

node.description:
__[Website](http://www.tsunku.net/)__

__Birthplace:__ Higashiosaka City, Osaka Prefecture, Japan
__Graduated:__ Kinki University (Faculty of Commerce)

__Introduction:__
Mitsuo Terada, alternatively known by stage name Tsunku, is a prolific Japanese record producer, songwriter, and vocalist.

__Biography:__
He is best known for having two major roles in the Japanese music landscape: first as the lead singer of the popular rock group Sharam Q, and now as the producer, primary composer, lyricist, and (until 2014) primary studio backing vocalist for highly popular idol group [Morning Musume](https://anilist.co/staff/150336/), in addition to Aya Matsuura and other associated idols under the Hello! Project banner, for whom he has written and produced the vast majority of their chart-topping hits. 

(Source: [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tsunku))

Tetsurou Kodama is a director, computer graphics director and background artist. According to him, it was [Cannon Fodder](https://anilist.co/anime/1462/Memories/), a movie by [Katsuhiro Ootomo](https://anilist.co/staff/96872) that was a part of Memories movie anthology, that inspired him to start making anime. He was awarded several prizes for the original short animated movies such as "My Home" and "Running Man". Currently, he is the representative director of studio Echoes, and he engages in various projects for creating TV animation, previews and commercials.
__Tomoki Nagasaka__ is a Japanese editor who works for post production studio Jay Film.
Ami Kutsuna is a color designer and digital painter.

Tetsurou Kodama is a director, computer graphics director and background artist. According to him, it was [Cannon Fodder](https://anilist.co/anime/1462/Memories/), a movie by [Katsuhiro Ootomo](https://anilist.co/staff/96872) that was a part of Memories movie anthology, that inspired him to start making anime. He was awarded several prizes for the original short animated movies such as "My Home" and "Running Man". Currently, he is the representative director of studio Echoes, and he engages in various projects for creating TV animation, previews and commercials.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Hiroki_Chura)

The current director of Chura Sound.
